page.title: 10Sheep at Demesne Farm
page.content: In the winter we don't do much except feed the sheep. April is the time for lambing. I sometimes get up in the night to go and look at the ewes. After lambing we have time to clean out the sheds. In June we have to take the wool off the ewes so they won't get hot. After shearing we dip the ewes so they won't get flies, because if they do the flies lay eggs and the sheep get maggots and die. We let them go back into a field and in a month's time we dip them again. In late October we put the ram to the ewes. If it snows we have to go round in the tractor to look for ewes and dig them out.
